message: By equipping hospitality workers with the tools to recognize and report potential cases, advocates of anti-sex trafficking efforts hope to provide alternate routes to stopping sex trafficking rings, where individuals are forced by other people to provide nonconsensual sex for a fee, aside from victims reporting the instances themselves.

data.description: Students at Quinnipiac University have been training Connecticut’s hospitality employees on recognizing and reporting the signs of a sex trafficking operation.
data.title: Law Students Equip Hotel Workers To Prevent Sex Trafficking
